etymology.interpretation: 米 signals a connection to grain/foodstuffs and, by extension, sweet edibles. 唐 contributes the pronunciation táng, and the compound came to denote sugar and sweets made from grains or cane.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃糖(我喜歡吃糖)。
这个蛋糕太甜，少放点糖(這個蛋糕太甜，少放點糖)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège dàngāo tài tián, shǎo fàng diǎn táng.
examples.english: This cake is too sweet; put in less sugar.

examples.chinese: 我咖啡里加了一勺糖(我咖啡裡加了一勺糖)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ kāfēi lǐ jiā le yì sháo táng.
examples.english: I added a spoonful of sugar to my coffee.
